title: Aluminum Hits 4-week High
summary: Aluminum prices increased to $2,917 per tonne, the highest since November 2025, gaining 1.35% over the past four weeks and rising 9.71% in the last 12 months. The rebound followed a recent low in late November, supported by favorable macroeconomic conditions.

title: Aluminum premium reaches record high in the US due to tariffs and global squeeze
summary: The US aluminum premium on the spot market reached a record $4,792 per ton due to tariffs and supply constraints. Benchmark London prices rose to $2,920 per ton, the highest since May 2022, driven by loss of Chinese aluminum on global markets and a 27% increase since April 2025 lows.

title: Alcoa: High US Aluminum Prices Offset Trump Tariff Costs
summary: Alcoa reported that US tariffs on Canadian aluminum cost $69 million more than the prior quarter, but higher domestic aluminum prices have more than offset these costs. The US Midwest premium has surged 113% since early June 2025, reflecting declining inventory and imports.

title: Aluminum Prices Hit 3-Year High: Is It the Next Key Metal in the Clean Energy Shift?
summary: Aluminum prices surged to around $2,800 per tonne, the highest in three years, driven by supply worries and growing demand from clean energy sectors like electric vehicles and renewable power. Tight supply is exacerbated by China's power shortages, environmental regulations, and geopolitical risks affecting bauxite supply.

title: Domestic Aluminum Billet Inventory in Two Regions Rises to 77,500 mt on Dec 10, 2025: SMM
summary: Inventory of aluminum billet in two domestic regions increased to 77,500 metric tons as of December 10, 2025. Despite this rise, ADC12 aluminum alloy prices are expected to continue fluctuating weakly in the short term due to supply-demand dynamics and cost factors.

title: Aluminum premium reaches record high in the US due to tariffs and global squeeze
summary: The U.S. aluminum market is experiencing record-high premiums driven by steep import tariffs and a global supply shortage. China's aluminum production is near its 45-million-ton annual cap, reducing exports and tightening global supply, which has led to a market deficit estimated at 1.8 million tons this year.

title: Column: China steel exports surge but aluminum shipments slide
summary: China's aluminum production is close to the 45 million ton cap, with increased domestic demand limiting exports, which have dropped 9.2% in the first 11 months of 2025. This reduction in Chinese aluminum exports has contributed to rising global prices, benefiting Western smelters facing high energy costs.

title: Aluminum Prices Hit 3-Year High: Is It the Next Key Metal in the Clean Energy Shift?
summary: Aluminum prices have surged to a three-year high due to rising demand from electric vehicles, solar, and grid upgrades, alongside supply constraints from China's power shortages and environmental regulations. Investment in renewable-powered smelting is increasing global low-carbon aluminum capacity by 3–4 million tons in 2025.

title: Benteler expands its casthouse at Raufoss plant in Norway for more sustainable production
summary: Benteler Group completed modernization of its casthouse in Norway, increasing recycled aluminum use from 30% to 40%, aiming for 50% by 2030. This upgrade is part of the 'BAR Green' project to reduce CO₂ emissions and enhance sustainable aluminum production.

title: New research could revolutionize the global aluminum industry - UNB
summary: Researchers at the University of New Brunswick developed a closed-loop, low-energy aluminum digestion process that improves aluminum smelting efficiency and sustainability. This process generates clean hydrogen gas and aluminum materials at a lower energy cost, supporting decarbonization and circular economy goals by using waste and salvage aluminum.

title: Investing In Innovation: GBCCA Showcases New Technology To Close The Recycling Loop For Aluminium Cans
summary: The Global Beverage Can Circularity Alliance (GBCCA) presented breakthrough technologies including robotics, AI, and home recycling systems at Climate Week NYC to achieve nearly 100% recycling of aluminum beverage cans by 2050. These innovations aim to boost recycling rates globally and support a circular economy for aluminum packaging.

title: Alcoa, Ball and Unilever debut carbon-free aluminium aerosol packaging
summary: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever launched an innovative aerosol can made with 50% ELYSIS aluminum and 50% post-consumer recycled content, representing one of the lowest-carbon packaging solutions. The ELYSIS process replaces carbon emissions with oxygen during smelting, eliminating direct greenhouse gas emissions and advancing sustainable packaging in personal and home care sectors.

title: Aluminum Prices Hit 3-Year High: Is It the Next Key Metal in the Clean Energy Shift?
summary: Aluminum demand is rising rapidly due to its essential role in electric vehicles, solar panels, and low-carbon infrastructure. Despite only 36% of aluminum being recycled globally, its high recyclability and new renewable-powered smelting projects are driving the metal's central role in decarbonization and sustainability efforts.

title: Silicon, aluminum and lithium scarcity threaten green technology development
summary: A study highlights that scarcity and extraction challenges of critical raw materials like aluminum could hinder green technology development vital for the green transition. The research emphasizes the need to improve recycling and reuse of these materials to meet sustainability goals and reduce pressure on natural resources.

title: World's first AlN-based high-frequency transistor for post-5G wireless communication
summary: NTT achieved the world's first millimeter-wave power amplification using aluminum nitride (AlN)-based transistors with over 75% aluminum composition. This breakthrough supports the evolution of wireless communication infrastructure beyond 5G, promising expanded coverage and higher speeds with potential applications in power conversion and wireless communications.

title: HRC Steel fell to 906.08 USD/T on December 9, 2025, down 0.21% from the previous day
summary: HRC Steel price decreased slightly to 906.08 USD/T on December 9, 2025, down 0.21% from the previous day. Over the past month, the price rose 6.47%, and it is up 34.23% compared to the same time last year. The price is expected to reach 914.08 USD/T by the end of the quarter and 998.71 USD/T in 12 months.

title: Steel unit price index falls 0.1 to 3.2 % in Nov - DoSM
summary: The unit price index of steel in Malaysia recorded a decrease ranging from 0.1 to 3.2 percent in November 2025 compared to the previous month, with the highest decreases in Miri and Kota Kinabalu. Year-on-year, the steel price index declined between 2.7 to 7.9 percent across most areas. Despite this, the cement price index increased in the same period.

title: SMU Price Ranges: Coated and plate inch higher, other products stable
summary: Steel prices for hot-rolled and cold-rolled coil held steady at multi-month highs, with hot-rolled coil at $895/st and cold-rolled coil at $1,070/st. Coated steel prices increased slightly, with galvanized steel reaching a six-month high of $1,035/st. Plate prices resumed rising, up $5/st to a near four-month high of $1,025/st. Price momentum indicates further increases are expected.

title: Decision to discontinue domestic price assessments for steel rebar and billet in India
summary: Fastmarkets has discontinued its price assessments for Indian domestic steel rebar and billet produced via the induction furnace route, as most quality long steel in India is now produced via the blast furnace route. This change took effect from December 10, 2025, following a consultation period. The discontinued prices included weekly assessments for rebar and billet in India.

title: American steel producers are gradually raising prices for rolled products
summary: American steel producers, including Nucor Bar Group, are increasing prices for rolled steel products. Nucor Bar Group raised the cost of all types of rebar by $30 per short ton for new orders received after November 7, 2025, reflecting a trend of gradual price increases in the US steel market.

title: US Steel to resume steel production at Illinois plant shut 2 years ago
summary: U.S. Steel announced it will restart steel slab production at its Granite City Works plant in Illinois, which was shut down two years ago. The company cited strengthening customer demand and plans to resume production in the first half of 2026 after hiring and training workers. This move is part of a broader $14 billion investment in U.S. steel production, including building a new electric furnace.

title: AISI: Raw steel production eases to near multi-month low
summary: U.S. raw steel production slightly declined to 1,734,000 short tons in the week ending December 6, marking the second-lowest weekly production since May. Despite the recent dip, year-to-date production is up 3.3% compared to last year, with a mill capability utilization rate of 75.7%. Regional production varied, with increases in the Northeast, Midwest, and West, and decreases in the Great Lakes and South regions.

title: Brazil steel quotas fill ahead of AD ruling
summary: Brazilian steel importers are filling quotas for cold-rolled coil and coated steel ahead of an anti-dumping ruling. The report also highlights a decline in Mexican steel production and consumption year-to-date October, with production down 9% amid a demand glut. The most produced and consumed steel products include rebar, hot-rolled coil, and galvanized steel.

title: October Steel Shipments Down 4.2 Percent From Prior Month
summary: Steel shipments in October 2025 decreased by 4.2% compared to the previous month. However, year-to-date shipments are up 5.1% compared to the same period in 2024, totaling over 76 million net tons. This indicates a generally positive trend in steel demand despite monthly fluctuations.

title: Tata Steel Secures Indo-Sweden Funding Under the Industry Transition Partnership for Two Decarbonisation Projects
summary: Tata Steel has received funding under the Indo-Sweden Industry Transition Partnership to collaborate on two projects aimed at accelerating decarbonisation in the steel and cement sectors. These projects focus on pioneering disruptive technologies and improving resource efficiency, including recovering metallics from steel slag and converting waste into sustainable cement materials.

title: Leading Indian companies collaborate with Sweden's innovators to drive decarbonisation in steel, cement sectors
summary: Several leading Indian companies, including Tata Steel and Jindal Steel, are partnering with Swedish technology leaders and Indian academic institutions to launch seven projects focused on reducing greenhouse gas emissions in steel and cement industries. This collaboration supports India's net-zero carbon emissions goal by 2070 through pre-pilot feasibility assessments of emerging technologies.

title: Steelmaking decarbonisation - BHP
summary: BHP is supporting steelmakers with multiple technology pathways to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, emphasizing the importance of cheaper renewable energy and carbon capture infrastructure. The company is investing in projects worldwide to develop steel production technologies capable of reducing emissions intensity by 30% compared to conventional methods, with widespread adoption expected after 2030.

title: Steel's carbon emissions dilemma: Retrofitting plants offers big cuts
summary: Researchers from UCL have developed a powerful database and economic model identifying cost-effective strategies to reduce carbon emissions from iron and steel plants globally. Their study highlights that plant-specific clean technology upgrades, supported by strong government policies, can chart a clear path to net-zero steel production cost-effectively.

title: Smelting Barriers: The Innovators Forging a New Future for Iron and Steel
summary: This article discusses emerging technologies and startups working to decarbonize the steel industry, including challenges like access to clean power and hydrogen. It highlights innovations such as advanced carbon nanomaterials replacing traditional steel components and the importance of partnerships among startups, corporates, and investors to achieve a resilient, low-emission steel sector.

title: Copper Rallies on Supply-Squeeze Fears
summary: Copper futures in the US climbed to around $5.4 per pound, hitting their highest levels in more than four months amid ongoing supply disruptions and a large withdrawal of metal from LME warehouses, fueling speculation of a supply squeeze. However, prices slipped slightly as investors weighed demand uncertainties from China, which is balancing stimulus with financial risk management.

title: Comex Copper Settles 2.31% Lower at $5.2405 — Data Talk
summary: Front Month Comex Copper for December delivery dropped 2.31% to $5.2405, marking the largest one-day dollar decline since late October 2025. The price has fallen for two consecutive sessions amid profit-taking and market caution, though it remains up 31.47% year-to-date and 24.08% month-to-date.

title: Copper price climbs to fresh high on China outlook boost
summary: Copper prices on the London Metal Exchange climbed as much as 1.3% to $11,771 a ton, surpassing previous all-time highs amid China's commitment to domestic growth and proactive fiscal policy for 2026. The rally is supported by strong demand from data centers and electric vehicles, supply constraints, and US stockpiling, with analysts warning that prices must average above $12,000 a ton next year to attract new mining investments.

title: Copper Prices Hold Steady As Fed Decision Looms
summary: Copper prices are steady near record highs as investors await the US Federal Reserve's policy decision amid ongoing supply constraints and mine disruptions. While copper trades near historical peaks, other metals show mixed results across major exchanges. The market remains cautious ahead of potential interest rate changes, with supply challenges supporting price stability.

title: Copper Prices Dip Amid Economic Uncertainty
summary: Copper prices declined due to trader caution ahead of the Federal Reserve's Open Market Committee meeting and economic uncertainty. Despite China's signals of a proactive fiscal approach, investor skepticism remains, with weakening demand indicators and record-low processing fees for copper rods putting downward pressure on prices.

title: Copper pressured by profit-taking ahead of Fed decision - Markets
summary: Copper prices slipped on profit-taking following a strong rally, amid concerns about slower US interest rate hikes. The market is cautious ahead of the Federal Reserve's decision, which is influencing metal prices including copper.

title: Copper price climbs to fresh high on China outlook boost
summary: Copper continued its record-breaking rally amid US stockpiling and China's commitment to domestic growth in 2026, boosting demand outlook. Prices on the London Metal Exchange reached $11,771 a ton, surpassing previous highs, driven by supply constraints and strong demand from data centers and electric vehicles. Analysts warn that prices must average above $12,000 a ton next year to incentivize new mining capacity investments.

title: Copper Prices Dip Amid Economic Uncertainty
summary: Copper prices fell on December 9 due to trader caution ahead of the Federal Reserve's Open Market Committee meeting and skepticism about China's economic stimulus effectiveness. Despite China's proactive fiscal approach, weakening demand signs emerged, including difficulties for fabricators to pass on high copper costs and record-low processing fees for copper rods.

title: Why 2026 could be copper's breakout year
summary: Production guidance for the QB2 copper project shows output of 170,000-190,000 tonnes in 2025, increasing to 220,000-255,000 tonnes by 2028. This gradual capacity growth is part of broader expectations that 2026 could mark a breakout year for copper due to supply constraints and rising demand.

title: Copper Chemicals Market — Global Growth, Segmentation, Forecast Through 2032
summary: The global copper chemicals market is expanding steadily, supported by increasing demand in various industrial applications. Growth projections extend through 2032, reflecting ongoing investments and capacity expansions in copper-related chemical production.

title: Fluor Awarded Engineering, Procurement and Integrated Construction Management Services Contract for Teck Resources Highland Valley Copper Mine Life Extension Project
summary: Fluor has been awarded a contract to provide engineering, procurement, and construction management services for the Highland Valley Copper Mine life extension project in British Columbia. This project reflects ongoing investment in extending the operational capacity of one of Canada's key copper mines.

title: Rio Tinto's Nuton technology produces first copper
summary: Rio Tinto's Nuton technology has achieved a breakthrough by producing copper with significantly reduced environmental impact, using up to 80% less water and 60% lower carbon emissions than conventional methods. The modular system integrates biology, chemistry, engineering, and digital tools to unlock resources from challenging ores, aiming for the lowest carbon footprint copper production in the U.S.

title: Copper for Tomorrow: Sustainable copper production
summary: The Copper for Tomorrow bid focuses on increasing sustainable copper production by addressing challenges in the value chain, especially processing lower grade ores with less energy and water. This initiative aims to double copper production sustainably to meet the growing demand driven by the clean energy transition and help companies achieve environmental, social, and governance (ESG) goals.

title: Analysis: copper set for new investment, recycling growth
summary: Copper demand is projected to rise sharply, with a global shortfall expected by 2035, driving new investments and growth in copper recycling. Recycling efforts, especially from e-scrap, are gaining momentum globally to supplement supply and reduce import reliance, with increasing pressure on recyclers to improve efficiency, traceability, and purity.

title: Sustainable and efficient operations for copper miners
summary: Copper miners are adopting digitalization, renewable energy, and innovative technologies to improve operational efficiency and reduce environmental impact. Examples include renewable energy agreements, alternative fuel trials, and advanced leaching technologies to extract copper from lower-grade ores, all aimed at meeting rising demand from renewables and electric vehicles sustainably.

title: Recycled Copper Market - Forecasts from 2025 to 2030
summary: The recycled copper market is expanding rapidly due to its environmental and economic benefits, including 85% less energy use compared to primary copper production. Recycling copper reduces landfill waste and conserves fossil fuels, making it a key sustainable solution to meet increasing copper demand across industries.

title: UNCTAD urges smarter copper trade as bottlenecks threaten global transition
summary: UNCTAD warns that a looming copper shortfall could hinder the global shift to clean energy and digital infrastructure. The report highlights the need for smarter trade policies, investment, and recycling to address supply constraints, with global demand expected to rise over 40% by 2040 amid challenges like low ore grades and geopolitical risks.

title: Nickel declines on negative price outlook for next year
summary: Nickel prices fell as Goldman Sachs issued a downbeat forecast, expecting prices to drop 6% to $14,500 per metric ton by December 2026. The bank cited supply surplus and subdued demand factors, with spot nickel prices down 0.7% at $14,900 per ton as of the report.

title: Nickel has a future despite low prices
summary: Nickel prices are at a five-year low due to a persistent global supply surplus driven mainly by Indonesian output. Despite this, long-term demand growth, especially from electric vehicles and planned supply restrictions, suggests a positive future outlook for nickel.

title: LME nickel prices extend weekly gains, hit 4-week high
summary: Nickel prices in December averaged $14,692, slightly above November's average of $14,670, with inventory levels remaining high. Prices extended weekly gains reaching a four-week high amid market fluctuations.

title: Nickel fell to 14,753 USD/T on December 10, 2025, down 0.15% from the previous day
summary: Nickel prices decreased slightly to $14,753 per ton, continuing a downward trend over the past month with a 1.81% fall and a 6.81% decline year-over-year. The price is expected to trade around $14,909 by the end of the quarter and $14,119 in 12 months.

title: [SMM Nickel Flash] December 10 news: Nickel prices extended their decline
summary: Nickel prices continued to decline on December 10 amid expectations around the US Federal Reserve's upcoming policy meeting. The market faces contradictions with firm upstream supply but weak demand.

title: Indonesia nickel matte production up 3.60% MoM in Nov
summary: Indonesia's nickel matte production reached 36,900 tonnes in nickel content in November 2025, marking a 3.60% month-on-month increase and a 20.16% year-on-year rise. The cumulative production from January to November 2025 was 296,100 tonnes, down 7.79% compared to the same period last year. December production is projected to slightly increase to 37,100 tonnes, including both high-grade and low-grade nickel matte.

title: DUMONT NICKEL PROJECT EXPECTED TO DELIVER $1.1 BILLION ANNUALLY TO CANADA AND ADVANCE NATIONAL CRITICAL MINERALS GOALS
summary: The Dumont Nickel Project in Québec is expected to generate $1.1 billion in annual real GDP for Canada, supporting thousands of skilled jobs and providing a secure nickel supply for North America and Europe. The project will increase Canadian nickel output by about 15%, bolstering battery and advanced materials supply chains, energy transition, and critical national-security industries such as defense and aerospace.

title: Vale Foresees Higher Iron Ore, Copper & Nickel Production Next Year
summary: Vale projects a 10% increase in nickel production for 2026, targeting 170,000-200,000 tons, alongside a 3% rise in iron ore and copper output. The company aims to meet the higher end of its 2025 production guidance and plans capital investments of $5.4 to $5.7 billion in 2026. Vale is positioning itself to become the world's largest iron ore producer while expanding its nickel output.

title: Aviseo study reveals $1.1B GDP impact for Dumont Nickel
summary: The Dumont Nickel Project in Quebec is expected to increase Canadian nickel output by approximately 15%, supporting battery supply chains and critical industries. The project will generate $1.9 billion in capital investment during construction phases from 2026 to 2035 and support nearly 11,000 jobs nationwide. It is designated a strategic project under the EU Critical Raw Materials Act, reinforcing supply-chain security for Canada and its allies.

title: Indonesia Signals Peak in Nickel Mining Investment as Focus Shifts to Batteries, EVs
summary: Indonesia's nickel mining boom has likely peaked, with the government shifting focus toward downstream battery production and electric vehicles. The rapid capital investment in upstream nickel extraction is slowing, emphasizing the utilization of processing capabilities developed in recent years. This marks a strategic pivot from raw nickel mining to value-added battery and EV industries.

title: Next-Gen Battery Chemistries Shift to Silicon and Nickel
summary: High-nickel cathode formulations like NMC, NCA, and NMCA are gaining momentum in next-generation battery applications, particularly for long-range EVs. These chemistries aim to reduce reliance on expensive and geopolitically volatile cobalt while increasing cell capacity, though they require more complex thermal management and manufacturing processes.

title: ZincFive Raises $30 Million in Oversubscribed Series F Financing to Power the Data Center Infrastructure Behind the AI Boom
summary: ZincFive secured $30 million in Series F funding to scale its patented nickel-zinc battery technology for AI-driven data center infrastructure. The technology delivers superior power density, inherent safety, and exceptional sustainability compared to lead-acid and lithium-ion alternatives.

title: Genomines raises $45M to grow nickel from plants, not mines
summary: French startup Genomines raised $45 million Series A funding for its innovative approach to extracting nickel from plants rather than traditional mining. The technology produces nickel concentrate that is 40-60% richer than conventional products and can be deployed in 1-2 years with operational costs cut by up to 50%.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali finalises a 200 million euro share capital increase and the acquisition of Special Melted Products in UK
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali completed a 200 million euro share capital increase to support growth and acquisitions, including the purchase of Special Melted Products in the UK. This move is part of the company's strategy to expand its footprint in the stainless steel sector.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne finalizes Mannesmann tubes acquisition to expand stainless footprint
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali finalized the acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Tubes from German steelmaker Salzgitter for EUR 135 million. This acquisition broadens Cogne's market presence in seamless tubes and stainless steel nickel alloy pipes, integrating Mannesmann’s operations in Germany, France, Italy, and the US.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali: 94% of the energy used comes from renewable sources and 93% of employees have permanent contracts
summary: On World Environment Day 2025, Cogne Acciai Speciali released its first Group Sustainability Report highlighting that over 94% of its electricity consumption comes from renewable sources. The company emphasizes sustainability as a core part of its corporate strategy and reports a high rate of permanent employment contracts.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: EC approves Mannesmann Stainless Pipes' acquisition by Cogne
summary: The European Commission approved Cogne Acciai Speciali's acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Pipes, allowing Cogne to gain control over MST and its subsidiaries across Europe and the US. The deal, valued at EUR 135 million, strengthens Cogne’s position in the seamless stainless steel and nickel-based tubes market.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started operations at a green hydrogen pilot plant in Aosta, Italy, marking a step towards sustainable steel production. This initiative aligns with the company’s commitment to reducing carbon emissions and advancing renewable energy use in its manufacturing processes.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Launch of the Italy–Canada Bilateral Energy Dialogue on the sidelines of the G7 Energy and Environment Ministers Meeting
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali is among Italian companies expressing strong interest in cooperation with Canada on energy security and critical minerals supply chains. The dialogue focuses on nuclear energy, renewable fuels, and decarbonization, highlighting Cogne’s role in strategic industrial partnerships.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris buys Penn. shredder from SA Recycling
summary: US steelmaker Tenaris has acquired SA Recycling's shredder and processing yard in Beaver Falls, Pennsylvania, enhancing its control over scrap supply and integrating steel production with scrap processing to streamline operations. This move aligns with a broader industry trend of steelmakers owning shredders and recycling facilities to manage costs and feedstock pricing more effectively.

title: Tenaris remains profitable in 2025
summary: Tenaris reported a $37 million profit in Q3 2025, marking a 15.6% increase from the previous quarter despite a 22.9% decline year-over-year. Sales in the North American oil and gas tube market remained steady, supported by stable activity from Rig Direct customers in the US and Canada, although some segments like Argentine fracking saw temporary slowdowns. The company expects sales to stay near Q3 levels but anticipates margin pressure from increased tariff costs.

title: Tenaris Announces 2025 Third Quarter Results
summary: Tenaris reported stable sales of tubular products and services in Q3 2025, with steady demand from US and Canadian Rig Direct customers and some shipment acceleration in the Middle East. While sales in Argentina's fracking and coiled tubing services were temporarily affected, overall net sales showed a slight year-on-year increase. The company noted that increased US tariffs on steel imports have reduced OCTG imports but prices have yet to fully reflect tariff impacts.

title: Prysmian Awarded The Italy-Tunisia Interconnection
date: Not explicitly dated in past 24 hours but recent
summary: Prysmian has been awarded the tender for the construction of the submarine power interconnection between Italy and Tunisia under the Elmed Project. The contract could reach a value of around €460 million and aims to create an energy bridge between Europe and Africa, enhancing energy security. The installation will be carried out by Prysmian's specialized vessel, Monna Lisa.

title: Prysmian lifts 2025 outlook after Q3 beat on strong transmission growth
summary: Prysmian upgraded its 2025 guidance after reporting third-quarter revenue and earnings slightly ahead of forecasts, driven by strong growth in its Renewable Transmission and Power Grids units. The company posted €5.03 billion in Q3 revenue, with significant organic growth in Renewable Transmission (39%) and Power Grids (15%). The strong performance is expected to benefit from copper tariffs in 2026.

title: Italy's Prysmian ditches plan to construct U.S. plant for offshore wind parks
summary: Prysmian announced it will abandon plans to build a plant in the U.S. for offshore wind park cables, citing insufficient market demand. The decision reflects a strategic shift despite Prysmian's significant role in offshore wind transmission globally.

title: World's top cable maker sees US copper tariff as opportunity
date: Not explicitly dated in past 24 hours but recent
summary: Prysmian views the U.S. copper tariff as an opportunity to strengthen the American supply chain. The company, which acquired Texas-based Encore Wire, expects the tariff to benefit local players due to its domestic copper sourcing and vertical integration.
